section.title:
Debugging Android applications
Android debuggable attribute in the AndroidManifest.xml
If you develop Android applications you can debug them via Eclipse. To enable debugging an a real Android device you need to add the android:debuggable="true" flag to the application segment in your AndroidManifest.xml file. The ADT tooling sets this flag automatically for debug builds based on the constant `DEBUG` of the `BuildConfig` class. This class is automatically updated by the ADT.
Turn debugging on at runtime in Eclipse
The JVM requires that you start a Java program in _Debug_ mode to debug it. Android allows you to turn debugging for a running application on at runtime via the Debug button in the Device view of the DDMS _perspective_ as depicted in the following screenshot.
Activate debugging
After turning debugging on in this view, the next time a _Breakpoint_ is encountered Eclipse allows you to debug the process.
